Reviews.Title: “My mother would die!”
Reviews.Author: OsopolarTromso
Reviews.Content: Haha! Dark, narrow corridors, minuscule capsule rooms, facing a shaft-like backyard, all up some steep stairs in an old Madrid building. This is a far cry from carpeted floors and minibars. BUT you have got all you need; a comfortable bed, a stool and a bathroom with a little tub and a toilet. It´s kept spotlessly clean, everyone is friendly, it´s safe, the location near Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor couldn´t be better and it is VERY cheap. Spend your money on tapas, tinto de verano, cañas etc, and stay at the La Perla Asturiana.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl of nostalgia”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located with a nice nostalgic feel: people should be more appreciative that there still are hotels like this. The staff were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Solitaire13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and although the rooms are small, this place is fabulous in terms of location. Plaza Mayor is just a few steps away and I could explore it until late night knowing my room was just around the block. The staff are friendly and courteous and most importantly, they speak English. The place has free Wifi. The rooms are clean and cozy. I wouldn't be comfortable staying here for a longer period but for 2 nights it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RealKathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2004 and remembered the street noise from late-night revelers. Yet the convenience to Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, the Prado, Reina Sofia, shops, restaurants, bars is so perfect that we returned. No elevator. Bring your own washcloth. Use ear plugs. Rooms are clean. Bathrooms are tiny, but en suite, which is nice. A shared shower/toilet/sink room is in the hall. We are bargain travelers, so the lack of fancy is fine. We like the price and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - decent for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: mp1212
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hostel is its amazing location - it is literally around the corner from Plaza Mayor, and only a five-to-ten minute walk to Plaza del Sol. Both areas are extremely beautiful and are bustling with cafes, bars and restaurants. There is also a metro stop right in this area. However, to balance out the great location, the hostel has a few flaws.\ La Perla Asturiana claims that its staff speaks English. Unfortunately, that is only about ten percent true. The staff operates on a need-to-communicate basis, meaning if they don't have to dig out their English skills, they won't. The rooms are kept as clean as possible, which isn't saying much considering all of the furniture and bedding look as though they are extremely old. Still, all the necessities are there and the balcony, which allows you to step out into the fresh air, provides some form of satisfaction. Remember to bring your own toiletries. There is a small computer located in the lobby where you can access the Internet for 1 Euro for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location 1 minute walk from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor”
Reviews.Author: Burrinha
Reviews.Content: Simple hostel right in the centre of the city, distance walking from the main attractions of the city. Welcoming staff, nice rooms with safe in the closet, good price. Not good was the fact that we didn't have breakfast included (I actually don't know if they have a breakfast room) and having it in one of the cafes close to the hostel can be very very expensive. We loved Madrid and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: kotzeto
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends two days in june 2010.The location is perfect-all things worth to see in Madrid are within a walking distance.The staff are very friendly.The rooms are a little bit small-but we did not expect large rooms for this price-bathrooms are o.k.The only thing that disturbed us was the noise all the night -we slept at open windows.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kittykatLisbon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hostel 2 nights. If you are traveling to madrid just for leisure, i advice it, because it is close to all the turistic and nightlife places. the rooms are small but are ok if you are planning to stay there just to have a few hours of rest. The best of it: it´s cheap!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulandSarahTamworth
Reviews.Content: This place seemed to tick all the boxes...at first. The sign said that guests can come and go 24 hours a day, but we were told to get back early because the night-duty man wanted to go to bed and was locking the door. When we did get back, the local homeless drunks sang all night below our window, which was ancient and wouldn't close properly. This is apparently where the homeless drunks spend each night, singing ang kicking shop shutters. It was so loud but the police didnot come. Then the street cleaners came out at 3am and began very very noisily jet washing the square below our window. and then the refuse collectors/bin men/ garbage men came out and began very noisily emptying the bins/garbage. It was 4am when things began to quieten, and it was then that I began to be itch. I turned on the light, and discovered that the bed was full of bed bugs. Within 10 minutes we were covered in lumps all over our bodies, and my girlfriend had an allergic reaction to them. We had to hunt them down and kill them in the room before we could get to sleep, which was around 5am by this time, but even then sleep was the last thing on our mind. We told the man at the desk in the morning and he acted as if this happens all of the time. Maybe it does. Maybe if we had been sound asleep we wouldn't have felt the bites? Either way - AVOID THIS PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: MayaLux
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of its superb location and convenient price. I'm used to staying in budget hotels and didn't expect any kind of luxury, but the quality of the accomodation was still well below my standards. The room was miniature and looked like a single room advertised as a double (until now I had no idea that a 120 cm bed can be called a "double"), no air conditioning, the bed was old, uncomfortable and squeaky and we had difficulty getting hot water in the shower. It looked fairly clean, but the bed linen and towels were so worn that it was difficult to say. Ear caps are a must if you want to get a good night sleep - every step and every word spoken in the hallway can be clearly heard in the room. Unfortunately I can't find any positive points except for the location, which is truly amazing - just around the corner from La Plaza Mayor! If you decide to stay here, make sure it's in a situation where you spend the whole day outside and only come to the hotel to sleep. A final comment: the hostal "boasts" with a sticker with a recommendation from Routard - from 1988. I guess it used to be recommendable 22 years ago...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, helpful”
Reviews.Author: Tuppi-two
Reviews.Content: We found the Hostal La Perla Asturiana to be everything good that we had read in Trip Adviser. It has no food available, but drinks could be ordered. However, all you had to do was walk out the hostal entrance into the square and there were three cafes within a few yards, all offering a good selection of drinks and food, including cooked breakfasts for those who just can't do without the full English. Our room was cleaned every morning and although the room was small it was perfectly adequate for our needs. We had some noisy neighbours though which was a bit of a nuisance since they seemed to want to sit in their room and chat till the wee small hours instead of going to a bar to chat like every one else did. We will certainly be staying there again as it was very convenient for getting around the city from Sol Metro, a few minutes walk away. Being so central, a number of the city attractions were within easy walking distance, as was the tourist open-top bus which we highly recommend as a means of choosing where you'd like to visit.

Reviews.Title: “If i have to say it in one word, try bye your self”
Reviews.Author: RHaagen
Reviews.Content: This hostel is in the heart of old Madrid an on a excellent location. Perfect to stay if you come back from yor outside and tired to go lay down on a good and clean room with excelent service a litle bit small but nice, with comfortable bed. The bathroom with bath and shower was good. Staff was very polite and helpful and most spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended For Value”
Reviews.Author: Frankie1973
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there at least 8 times over the last 4 years and will continue to do so. I have been there with my husband, and with my children and also with my family and parents and had no problems on any of the occasions. Some of the rooms are a little on the small side but they serve their purpose because when you are in a City as beautiful as Madrid why would you want to stay in your room. It is situated right beside the Plaza Mayor, Sol, many fantastic restaurants (most of which are great value, especially El Museo Del Jamon).It is also less than 5 mins away from "El Rastro" a big market on Sunday mornings. There are many underground stations and bus services Very close by. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean, once again I can't stress enough the great value......Younwill have to see for yourself, ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: This is a small quiet hotel, which is perfectly situated close to Plaza Mayor without the expense. It takes 5 minutes to the metro at Sol.Yes, the rooms are small, but they are very clean and tended to daily. The staff were very helpful. It isn't a 5 star hotel, so visitors shouldn't expect 5* standard! In Madrid you are out all day so only need a comfy bed to lay your head at night and La Perla is perfect for that! They are some super restautants to dipchorros into your hot chocolate. I would recommend this hotel for young couples or friends travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “Not a palace but good value.”
Reviews.Author: Luzite
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 3 night weekend break and found this hostal to be excellent value. We paid 160€ for 3 nights in a double room with private bathroom. Our room was small and quite dated decoration wise, the bathroom was the smallest I've ever seen but it was very clean and the maids came every morning, cleaned it and put out fresh towels. There was a safe in the room which required 1€ to lock it. The coin was not returnable so you need a new coin each time you use it but worth it for the peace of mind! As mentioned before the location is excellent and we were able to walk everywhere. If all you want is a clean, cheap place to sleep in the old part of the city and aren't too bothered about decor or facilities, then this could be the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Really central, a right bargin- muy bien!”
Reviews.Author: worldwiderambler
Reviews.Content: I organised the accommodation for my friends which is always a scare incase its bad but we were mildly impressed. It does depend what you want as the hostel is not grand by any means and the rooms are small and possible need a lick of paint... but the rooms are tidy, staff pleasent and what it lacks in stature it gains in bounds by location! you are two seconds from the Plaza Mayor and 5mins from the tube station 'Sol'. Advice: don't be conded into a taxi at the airport take the metro far cheap and not that difficult to find (print off a tube map and one of the hotel before you set off). Avoid eating in the plaza mayor the cafe outside the hostel is excellent and beaware of a club with severn floors (I have forgotten the name) as we were told it was cheap by some locals... is mucho dinero! but have fun with the whole city to explore we took in a football game as well, tickets booked on line- great seats fantastic game! adios

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Shefford
Reviews.Content: As noted by other reviewers, this hotel is in an excellent location, a few steps from the Plaza Mayor and a few minutes from the Puerto del Sol. Attractions such as the Prado and the Palacio Real are also within walking distance. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small, but clean and with adequate storage space. Reception staff were friendly and helpful and were able to direct us to the best areas for restaurants. The hotel does not offer breakfast, but we had very good coffee, fresh orange juice and croissants in the "Corner Cafe", in the plaza where the hotel is situated. Recommended for anyone who wants basic, clean, reasonably priced accomodation in the heart of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at great location.”
Reviews.Author: AlexMorrisIL
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, in the heart of old Madrid. Perfect for someone who will spend all day outside and come back tired to sleep. The room with high ceilings was small, but nice, clean and with comfortable bed. The bathroom with bath and shower was good. Staff was very polite and helpful and most spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Perfet for someone who will spend all day outside and come back tired to sleep. It has all necessary minumum. The room was very small, but had a private bathroom and a TV. The hostel has a computer with internet access for 1 euro per 30 min. The staff is friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal la Perla Asturiana
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza de Santa Cruz, 3, 28012 Madrid, Spain
